topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Configuring the Monitoring Service

section.p: In Beta 2 you will have the option to specify which database platform you want to use for the Metrics Database.

The Monitoring service supports two different database options. The default metrics database is Vertica, which is a highly-scalable analytics database from HP. Vertica is free to use, up to 12TB, for all paid Helion customers as a Helion operational database . Vertica is the recommended database for Helion OpenStack.
You can learn more about Vertica here: Vertica Documentation
The alternative opensource database option is InfluxDB. InfluxDB is an emerging opensource monitoring database, however the current release contains the following limitation:

ul.li: InfluxDB cluster does not recover upon node failure.

sectiondiv.p: In order to replace the default database option with InfluxDB as the metrics database, you need to follow these steps:
During the Configure Your Environment portion of the installation, ensure you make these configuration file edits:

ol.li:
On your deployer, edit the following two files:
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file and under your control plane cluster service-clusters section, edit the entry for vertica to read influxdb.
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/disks_controller.yml and either replace the existing vertica information or insert the information for InfluxDB as seen below in the section labeled for logical-volumes on the DISK_SET_CONTROLLER:
- name: influxdb size: 5% mount: /var/opt/influxdb fstype: ext4 mkfs-opts: -O large_file consumer: name: influxdb

sectiondiv.p: Then, before you run the site.yml playbook as part of the Deploy the Cloud installation step, make these changes:

ol.li:
Edit the ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/monasca-variables/defaults/main.yml file and add the lines below between the vertica_users and vertica_resource_pools_limits entries near the bottom of the file:
vertica_api_user: "{{ MON_API.consumes_FND_VDB.vars.vertica_monasca_api_user }}" vertica_api_password: "{{ MON_API.consumes_FND_VDB.vars.vertica_monasca_api_password }}" vertica_persister_user: "{{ MON_PST.consumes_FND_VDB.vars.vertica_monasca_persister_user }}" vertica_persister_password: "{{ MON_PST.consumes_FND_VDB.vars.vertica_monasca_persister_password }}"

sectiondiv.p: Then, when running your site.yml playbook as part of the Deploy the Cloud installation step, ensure that you use the -e database_type=influxdb switch. For example:
sectiondiv.note: Ensure you use any other necessary switches based on your setup that may be included in other parts of the installation documentation.
